image.title: CoinDesk: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Crypto News and Price Data

item.title: First Mover Asia: Chip Maker Nvidia Isn’t an Ether Proxy, Bitcoin Holds Near $21K
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds, James Rubin
item.description: Crypto aided Nvidia's bottom line, but it has not been a major cause of the stock's steep decline; bitcoin hovers near $21K.

media:content.media:description: An Asus graphics card (Joseph Greve/Unsplash)

item.title: CoinFLEX to Launch a $47M Recovery Token to Solve Withdrawal Issues
item.dc:creator: Michael Bellusci
item.description: CoinFLEX said last week it was halting withdrawals amid the recent market downturn and counterparty uncertainty.

media:content.media:description: CoinFLEX halted withdrawals. (FLY:D/Unsplash, modified by CoinDesk)

item.title: Solana’s Macalinao Brothers Double Down on Crypto Venture Fund
item.dc:creator: Danny Nelson
item.description: Crypto VCs told CoinDesk that building projects and investing in them is a tricky mix.

media:content.media:description: Ian Macalinao is one half of the Saber brothers. (Danny Nelson/CoinDesk)

item.title: Ms. Crypto Goes to Washington
item.dc:creator: Adelle Nazarian, Todd White
item.description: The Lummis-Gillibrand crypto bill represents a mainstreaming of crypto, even if it's unlikely to pass.

media:content.media:description: U.S. Capitol (uschools/Getty Images)

item.title: Market Wrap: Recession Fears Halt Crypto Bounce
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor, Jimmy He
item.description: Analysts see too few positive signs to sustain a crypto rally as investors position for further pain in traditional markets.

media:content.media:description: Bitcoin is "balancing" at about $21,000. (Unsplash)

item.title: Solana’s Biggest DeFi Lender Almost Got Rekt. Then Binance Stepped In
item.dc:creator: Danny Nelson
item.description: Solend’s whale crisis rattled depositors and threatened to crash Solana. Can the lending protocol recover?

media:content.media:description: (State Library of New South Wales/Wikimedia Commons)

item.title: Bitcoin mantiene nivel de $20K en medio de signos de impulso alcista
item.dc:creator: Jimmy He
item.description: Los analistas dicen que se necesitan signos de mejora en la economía general para lograr un crecimiento sostenido.

media:content.media:description: El gráfico del precio de bitcoin durante la última semana ilustra el retroceso del mercado del lunes. (CoinDesk)

item.title: Robinhood Shares Spike on Report FTX May Be Seeking to Acquire It
item.dc:creator: Nelson Wang
item.description: Plans are still in the preliminary stages, according to a report from Bloomberg.

media:content.media:description: Robinhood app on smartphone (Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg via Getty Images)

item.title: Few Signs of Upward Momentum as Bitcoin Holds $20K
item.dc:creator: Jimmy He
item.description: BTC maintains $20K price level but analysts say wider economic improvements are needed for sustained growth.

media:content.media:description: Chart of bitcoin’s price over the past week illustrates Monday’s market retracement. (CoinDesk)

item.title: Grayscale Lines Up Jane Street and Virtu as 'Authorized Participants' if GBTC Converts to ETF
item.dc:creator: Michael Bellusci
item.description: Grayscale is awaiting a decision from the SEC on its GBTC product in hopes of converting to a spot Bitcoin ETF.

media:content.media:description: Grayscale's new ad campaign can be seen in New York's Penn Station. (Nikhilesh De/CoinDesk)

item.title: Plataforma de pagos B2B Tribal se une a grupo de lobby Blockchain Association
item.dc:creator: Andrés Engler
item.description: La compañía, enfocada en mercados emergentes, se convierte en miembro del grupo de lobby cripto y planea comprometerse con los reguladores y otros actores.

media:content.media:description: Tribal ofrece una plataforma de pago business-to-business. (Tribal)

item.title: Web3 Adoption Is 'Inevitable,' Blockchain Creative Labs CEO Says
item.dc:creator: Fran Velasquez
item.description: “We believe we can leverage the Fox platform to teach people what it means [for] them to value a digital good [and] the value of an NFT,” Blockchain Creative Labs CEO Scott Greenberg said during an interview with CoinDesk at NFT.NYC.

media:content.media:description: Blockchain Creative Labs CEO Scott Greenberg during an interview with CoinDesk at NFT.NYC (CoinDesk, modified)

item.title: Recent Crypto 'Bloodbath' Is Not Necessarily Bad, Regulators Say
item.dc:creator: Camomile Shumba
item.description: The recent crypto market downturn can help weed out bad actors and unsustainable projects, a number of regulators and entrepreneurs said at a forum in Zurich last week.

media:content.media:description: The recent crypto crash might have a silver lining: Some industry sources contend that it could ultimately bring about more stability. (Jonny Clow/Unsplash)

item.title: B2B Payments Platform Tribal Joins the Blockchain Association
item.dc:creator: Andrés Engler
item.description: The emerging markets-focused company is becoming a member of the crypto lobbying group and plans to engage with regulators and other stakeholders.

media:content.media:description: Tribal offers a business-to-business payment platform. (Tribal)

item.title: Introducing Future of Work Week
item.dc:creator: Ben Schiller
item.description: Decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) are the new way of work, attracting people who don't want to work for companies anymore.

item.title: NFT, Private Wallet Fates Hang on EU Crypto Talks This Week
item.dc:creator: Jack Schickler
item.description: Officials could this week finalize controversial privacy and licensing rules for the sector – once they decide how to treat NFTs and unhosted wallets.

media:content.media:description: The European Parliament is set to make key decisions on crypto privacy and NFTs this week. (Laura Zulian Photography/Getty Images)

item.title: Grayscale Remains ‘Unequivocally Committed’ to Converting GBTC to an ETF

item.title: Crypto Exchange Unizen Receives $200M 'Capital Commitment' From Investment Group GEM
item.dc:creator: Jamie Crawley
item.description: Cryptocurrency exchange Unizen has received $200 million from alternative investment group Global Emerging Markets (GEM) to accelerate development of its trade aggregation system.

media:content.media:description: Unizen has received $200 million from alternative investment group Global Emerging Markets. (Shutterstock)

item.title: Azuro Raises $4M for ‘Decentralized Sportsbook Protocol’

item.description: The funding marks the latest injection of capital into the nascent blockchain betting industry.

item.title: Chase Chapman on DAOs and Professional Polyamory

item.description: “There's a lot of value in talent that doesn't want to be held down by one organization.” This interview is part of CoinDesk's "Future of Work" Week.

item.title: FTX Token DAO Raises $7M From Community of Sam Bankman-Fried Fans
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: The dedicated FTX token (FTT) DAO has raised $7 million from its community members as plans to invest in crypto education and DeFi.

item.title: Según Morgan Stanley, la demanda de GPUs podría ralentizarse si Ethereum pasa a proof-of-stake
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: El cambio tampoco resolverá los problemas de escala de Ethereum, agregó el informe del banco.

item.description: The latest price moves in bitcoin ($BTC) and crypto markets in context, for June 24, 2022.

item.title: Goldman Cuts Coinbase to ‘Sell’ Due to Fall in Crypto Prices and Industry Activity; Shares Drop
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: The company faces a difficult choice between shareholder dilution and effective employee compensation, the report said.

media:content.media:description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong (Coinbase)

item.title: Payroll, Web3 and the $62B Opportunity
item.dc:creator: Megan Knab
item.description: Crypto can make it faster and cheaper to pay workers. This article is part of the “Future of Work” series.

media:content.media:description: (Viktor Forgacs/Unsplash)

item.title: You’re Hiring Wrong: Do It More Like Web3
item.dc:creator: Avi Meyers
item.description: By adopting a more open, fluid model, traditional firms would find it easier to attract talent and end up with a more passionate, engaged workforce.

media:content.media:description: Instead of a gated community, think of your entry-level talent pool as a community garden where anyone can come and contribute. (Tim Mossholder/Unsplash, modified by CoinDesk)

item.title: The Crypto Jobs Boom
item.dc:creator: Jeff Wilser
item.description: It may be a bear market, but there are still plenty of jobs to be had at crypto companies. This article is part of CoinDesk's "Future of Work" Week.

media:content.media:description: (Yunha Lee/CoinDesk)

item.title: Voyager Digital Issues Default Notice to Three Arrows Capital
item.dc:creator: Jamie Crawley
item.description: Crypto broker has issued a notice of default to Three Arrows Capital (3AC) after the beleaguered hedge fund failed to make the required payments on its loans of 15,250 bitcoin and $350 million in USDC.

media:content.media:description: Steve Ehrlich, co-founder and CEO of Voyager Digital (YouTube)

item.title: Crypto Hedge Funds, Traders Short Tether After UST’s Implosion: Report
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: The positions are worth at least “hundreds of millions” of dollars in notional value, one trader said.

item.title: Morgan Stanley: GPU Demand Likely to Slow if Ethereum Moves to Proof-of-Stake
item.dc:creator: Will Canny
item.description: A mov to PoS will also not solve Ethereum’s scaling problems, the report said.

media:content.media:description: Ethereum's Merge will slow demand for GPUs. (Bradley D. Saum/Shutterstock)

item.title: Ethereum Lending Protocol XCarnival Hit With $3.8M Exploit, Recovers 50%
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knight
item.description: Singapore-based metaverse lending protocol XCarnival recovered 1,467 ether following an exploit that saw a hacker siphon 3,087 ETH out of the platform.

media:content.media:description: Some $3.8 million was siphoned from NFT lending platform XCarnival (Kevin Ku/Unsplash)

item.title: Australian Crypto Exchange Banxa Lays Off 70
item.dc:creator: Shaurya Malwa
item.description: The publicly traded crypto exchange said the "crypto winter" drove the decision to reduce headcount by about 30%.

media:content.media:description: Staff leaving (Joao Viegas/Unsplash)

item.title: Nexo Sends Cease-and-Desist Letter to Anonymous Twitter Account Accusing It of Embezzlement
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds
item.description: The Twitter account “@otteroooo” has claimed that crypto lender Nexo embezzled funds from a charity. Nexo says the the account user is intentionally using the name of someone unrelated to Nexo.

media:content.media:description: (Rich Miller/Flickr)

item.title: First Mover Asia: Bitcoin Holds Above $21K in Weekend Trading, Solana Web3 Phone Faces Long Odds
item.dc:creator: Sam Reynolds, James Rubin
item.description: Prior blockchain phones have failed because the market have realized their functionalities are available already via apps that can be loaded onto any old phone; ether stays above $1,200.

media:content.media:description: Bitcoin was down slightly on Sunday, but still trading at over $21,000. (Jay Radhakrishnan)

item.title: Opaque Platforms and Intertwined Protocols Pose Big Risk to Crypto
item.dc:creator: George Kaloudis
item.description: Second article in a series about risks we’re thinking about during these crypto down days.

media:content.media:description: Interdependent protocols and black-box platforms make for a dicey pairing. (Edge2Edge Media/Unsplash)

item.title: Morgan Creek Is Trying to Counter FTX’s BlockFi Bailout, Leaked Call Shows
item.dc:creator: Tracy Wang
item.description: FTX’s $250 million credit facility offer – if inked as initially proposed – stood to effectively wipe out all BlockFi shareholders, including Morgan Creek Digital, the firm told its investors.

media:content.media:description: Mark Yusko, founder of Morgan Creek Capital Management, speaks at Consensus 2018. (CoinDesk archives)

item.title: Bitcoin se estabiliza cerca de $21K; inversores esperan evitar otra caída el fin de semana
item.dc:creator: Jimmy He
item.description: Los analistas se cuestionan si BTC podrá mantenerse por encima del umbral de $20.000 en un clima de desconfianza entre los inversores.

media:content.media:description: Bitcoin subió en el trading del día viernes. (Jay Radhakrishnan)

item.title: Market Wrap: From GBTC Discount to Short Bitcoin ETF, Traders See Reasons for Optimism
item.dc:creator: Bradley Keoun, Jimmy He
item.description: It's hard to imagine that data showing traders piling into a trade designed to profit from further bitcoin price declines might be bullish, but that's how some analysts are interpreting the signal.

media:content.media:description: Seemingly bearish market indicators are seen by analysts as reasons for optimism. (Creative Commons)

item.title: Goldman Sachs Leading Investor Group to Buy Celsius Assets: Sources
item.dc:creator: Tracy Wang
item.description: The Wall Street firm is seeking $2 billion in commitments from investors to buy distressed assets at steep discounts if the crypto lender goes bankrupt.

media:content.media:description: Goldman Sachs is said to have an eye on Celsius. (Chris Hondros/Getty Images)

item.title: Why the Crypto Crash Will Accelerate Regulatory Action
item.dc:creator: Tracy Basinger, Jonah Crane
item.description: Recent events, including the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin, are likely to hasten regulators consideration of crypto regulation.

media:content.media:description: U.S. Capitol Building (uschools/Getty Images)

item.title: Es argentino, ofrece tours en Airbnb para explicar bitcoin y a los turistas les encanta
item.dc:creator: Marina Lammertyn
item.description: Después de que Argentina confiscara sus ahorros dos veces, Jerónimo Ferrer descubrió bitcoin y convirtió su historia en un recorrido con cientos de visitantes y una calificación de 4,9 (sobre 5) estrellas en Airbnb.

media:content.media:description: Jerónimo Ferrer en Buenos Aires, explicando bitcoin a turistas. (Jerónimo Ferrer/Airbnb)

item.title: With Bitwise and Grayscale Decisions Looming, Spot Bitcoin ETF Approval Hopes Are Running Low
item.dc:creator: Michael Bellusci
item.description: Final deadlines for approval by the SEC for the two applications are fast approaching.

media:content.media:description: Grayscale CEO Michael Sonnenshein, second from right, attending a Consensus event in 2016 (CoinDesk archives)

item.title: This Buenos Aires Evangelist Offers Tours to Expound Bitcoin, Tourists Love It
item.dc:creator: Marina Lammertyn
item.description: After having his savings confiscated by Argentina twice, Jerónimo Ferrer discovered bitcoin. And he made his story into a tour with hundreds of visitors and high ratings.

media:content.media:description: Jerónimo Ferrer with a Bitcoin t-shirt, explaining the crypto boom in Argentina to tourists. (Jerónimo Ferrer/Airbnb)

item.title: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust's 'GBTC Discount' Narrows With ETF Decision on Horizon
item.dc:creator: Lyllah Ledesma
item.description: Shares of the GBTC are trading at a discount of 29% to bitcoin’s price, down from 34% last week – and there's all sorts of speculation on what it means.

media:content.media:description: The "Grayscale discount" has narrowed after widening out to 34% last week. (Skew)

item.title: Bitcoin Hovers Near $21K as Investors Look to Avoid Another Weekend Slump
item.dc:creator: Jimmy He
item.description: Bitcoin held steady at about $21K, but analysts say its hold above 20K is precarious.

media:content.media:description: Bitcoin rose in Friday trading. (Jay Radhakrishnan)

item.title: BlockFi Raises Deposit Rates, Eliminates Free Withdrawals
item.dc:creator: Sam Kessler
item.description: The rate increases across BTC, ETH, USDT and other crypto deposits come after layoffs at the company and a $250 million emergency line of credit from FTX.

media:content.media:description: BlockFi is set to offer higher yields on deposits. (Torsten Asmus/Getty images)

item.title: European Crypto Exchange Bitpanda Cuts Staff by Hundreds
item.dc:creator: Michael Bellusci
item.description: Bitpanda announced it is reducing its employee count to 730, down from about 1,000.

media:content.media:description: Bitpanda co-founders (left to right) Christian Trummer, Paul Klanschek and Eric Demuth.

item.title: Investors Pile Into Short Bitcoin ETF Betting on Prices to Fall
item.dc:creator: Krisztian Sandor
item.description: ProShares Inverse Bitcoin ETF (BITI) saw large inflows after a lackluster opening day.

media:content.media:description: ProShares' short bitcoin ETF toppled Valkyrie's and VanEck's future-based ETFs in assets under management. (Arcane Research)
